ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Perfect place for this question
ygData.msgSnippet: Soooooooo... what was the question?  The generation gap causing difficulties later on?  That s really the only thing you have to think about.  I dated someone
ygData.messageBody:
Soooooooo... what was the question? The generation gap causing difficulties
later on? That's really the only thing you have to think about. I dated
someone 14 years older than me and since our life experiences were so
different, and our aims and goals so different, we were unable to resolve
our disparity. Of course, we couldn't tell that at the beginning of the
relationship. It took three years out of our lives and caused a great deal
of anguish, as neither of us could forgive the other for not bridging that
gap more perfectly. Like I said (IMO), that's the big question. The only
question, actually.

Suzanne
"Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace."
~Amelia Earhart

----- Original Message -----
From: "Just me" <scadis@...>
To: <EQ_women@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, April 27, 2003 2:46 AM
Subject: [EQ_women] Perfect place for this question


> Ok, to keep with this same line of thought ~ of "hooking up" on EQ.
> I am 43 and have been playing EQ for about a year. A friend got me
> into the game, and I played it just as a game. I don't think I
> realized how much I looked forward to running into certain
> friends/characters in the game. I have made what I feel to be many
> good friendships. Ok to the question. One friend that I felt very
> close to became closer. We talked on the phone and kept in touch
> almost everyday. I am divorced and single and he is single. He came
> to Arizona to visit me and sure one thing led to another and the
> rest is history. We are both wildly happy and in love, want to spend
> the rest of our lives together and fade into the sunset happily ever
> after. Here is my dilema ~ like I said I am 43, a young 43 (and its
> not me saying that) my picture is on my profile ~ he is 20, a very
> mature, responsible 20 but none the less 20. What in the hell do I
> do??? Most of me wants to say screw what others might think and just
> be happy with him, but the rest of me says leave him to live his
> life. When I discuss that with him he just says stop trying to find
> excuses why we can't be together and just be happy. How can I argue
> with that??? Some advice ladies?? please
>
